Author: ETMarkets.com
Headline: LTIMindtree shares  down  0.69% as Nifty  falls
Description: The stock quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 6442.65 and low of Rs 4488.5.
Article Body: Shares of LTIMindtree Ltd. rose 0.69 per cent to Rs 4669.5 in Tuesday's trade. It hit an intraday high of Rs 4726.15 and low of Rs 4654.0, respectively, during the day.   The stock quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 6442.65 and low of Rs 4488.5.   As of 12:33PM (IST), the counter saw total traded volume of 3,746 shares with a traded value of Rs 1.75 crore, according to NSE.   The stock had closed at Rs 4702.35 in the previous session.   The scrip has declined -5.21 per cent in the past one month till date, while the benchmark BSE Sensex has slipped -0.93 per cent during the same period.   According to exchange data, the stock traded at a price-to-earnings (P/E) multiple of 29.97 while price-to-book ratio stood at 7.3. A higher P/E ratio shows that investors are willing to pay a higher price for per rupee earnings given by the stock because of better future growth expectations. The price-to-book value indicates the inherent value of a company and it reflects the price investors are ready to pay even for no growth in a business.   The stock belongs to the IT Consulting & Software - Mid Cap industry.    Promoter/FII Holding  Promoters held 68.6 per cent stake in the company as of 31-Mar-2024, while FII and MF ownership in the firm stood at 7.86 per cent and 6.22 per cent, respectively.    Key Financials  The company reported consolidated sales of Rs 9100.5 crore for the quarter ended 31-Mar-2024, down 1.47 per cent from the previous quarter's Rs 9236.1 crore and down 3.92 per cent from the year-ago quarter's Rs 8757.4 crore. Its net profit for the latest quarter stood at Rs 1099.9 crore, down 1.24 per cent from the same quarter a year ago.

Author: Akash Podishetty
Headline: L&T Q4 Results Preview: Profit may rise 11% year-on-year; revenue growth seen healthy
Description: L&T Q4 Results Preview: L&T set to show strong growth in Q4 2024, with revenue expected to increase by up to 17% YoY and net profit by up to 11% YoY. Key factors include domestic tender pipeline and margin performance.
Article Body: Infrastructure major Larsen and Toubro (L&T) is expected to report healthy growth in revenues for the quarter ended March 2024, led by strong improvement in E&C segment.Revenue from operations are likely to grow up to 17% year-on-year, according to an average estimate of four brokerages. Meanwhile, net profit for the same period is seen rising up to 11% year-on-year.Key monitorables for investors in the report card include domestic tender pipeline, margin performance as well as working capital cycle. Analysts would also look out for an execution ramp-up in Saudi projects and an expected pipeline in the Middle East.In the preceding December quarter, the company saw 15% year-on-year (year-on-year) growth in consolidated net profit at Rs 2,947 crore and revenue from operations rose nearly 19% to Rs 55,128 crore.Here's what to expect from L&T's Q4:Kotak EquitiesWe expect 18% year-on-year improvement in core EPC revenues as we bake in improved construction activity across projects during the first two months and a weak March.We expect core E&C business EBITDA margin at 9.9%, up 70 bps year-on-year on low base (flat on a two-year basis).NuvamaWhile govt capex and ME hydrocarbon ordering shows strong momentum, private capex is yet to show its best. FY26's strategic plan is to focus on making subsidiaries self-sustainable, strong presence into green energy (hydrogen, battery storage etc.) and non-core exits. With robust order inflow growth, execution completion of legacy projects, refinancing of Hyderabad metro etc., margins may see ramping up but at a slower pace.Pickup in core E&C OPMs remains key to L&T. New orders momentum remains robust on international hydrocarbon, mobility and power T&D side.Motilal OswalExpect consolidated revenue growth of 11% year-on-year, led by 12% year-on-year core E&C revenue growth. We expect Core E&C EBITDA margin of 9%, up 50 bps year-on-year, as legacy orders are near the completion.(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times)

Article Body: Shares of Jubilant Foodworks Ltd. gained 0.34 per cent to Rs 474.25 in Tuesday's session as of 11:36AM (IST) even as the equity benchmark Sensex traded 539.17 points lower at 73356.37.   Earlier in the day, the stock witnessed a gap up start to the session. The stock quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 586.35 and a 52-week low of Rs 420.85 on NSE. Around 66402 shares changed hands on the counter till 11:36AM (IST).   The stock opened at Rs 475.15 and has touched an intraday high and low of Rs 478.05 and Rs 471.6 during the session so far. The scrip quoted a price-to-earnings (PE) ratio of 131.46, earnings per share (EPS) of Rs 3.34 and price to book value (PB) of 14.26, while the return on equity (ROE) stood at Rs 17.33.    Promoter/ FII Holding The promoters held 41.94 per cent stake in the company as of May 07, while FII and MF ownerships stood at 23.24 per cent and 19.98 per cent, respectively.    Key Financials   With a market capitalisation of Rs 31184.28 crore, the company operates in the Restaurant & QSR industry. For the quarter ended 31-Dec-2023, the company reported consolidated sales of Rs 1382.27 crore, up 0.48 per cent from the previous quarter?s Rs 1375.69 crore and up 3.05 per cent from the same quarter a year ago. The company reported net profit of Rs 65.71 crore for the latest quarter, down 18.24 per cent from the corresponding quarter last year.    Technical Indicators  The relative strength index (RSI) of the stock stands at 62.75. The RSI oscillates between zero and 100. Traditionally, it is considered overbought condition when the RSI value is above 70 and oversold condition when it is below 30. Analysts say the RSI indicator should not be seen in isolation, as it may not be sufficient to take a trading call, just the way a fundamental analyst cannot give a  buy  or  sell  recommendation using a single valuation ratio.

Author: Twesh Mishra and Shilpa Samant
Headline: Norms eased to draw in more suppliers for power equipment
Description: India's primary planning and advisory body for the power sector has loosened a significant condition for power equipment supplies in public sector projects, aiming to enable utilities to issue tenders that facilitate greater involvement from private vendors, sources familiar with the matter revealed.
Article Body: India's apex planning and advisory body for the power sector has eased a key condition for power equipment supplies for public sector projects, a move that is expected to let utilities to issue tenders allowing larger private vendor participation, people familiar with the development said. This change was advised after some recent tenders from companies such as NTPC and Damodar Valley Corporation to build thermal projects under engineering-procurement-construction (EPC) contracts received muted response. Some of these projects saw single bids. The Central Electricity Authority (CEA) has relaxed the pre-qualification requirements, allowing companies with experience in erection of 'sub-critical' units to participate in 'supercritical' projects to encourage competition. Public sector undertaking Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd and Larsen & Toubro are said to have been among the few qualified under the earlier regime. It is now expected that Thermax, GE Power as well as some other companies will also qualify for the tenders under the relaxed qualifications.  A decision to make this change was made in April,  a senior official aware of the move told ET.109894917 The previous condition of experience of establishing supercritical units was limiting vendors from participation, according to two officials. The tender for NTPC's 1,600 MW Singrauli-III thermal power station saw just one bid and the quoted price was  high , said another official. There was also only one bidder for Damodar Valley Corporation's Raghunathpur Phase-II project and the company is likely to go for a rebid. Retendering for the Damodar Valley project is expected to be made under the amended condition. Power generators can decide on the mode of tendering - split, single EPC or package wise.Utilities may explore addition of consortium routes with limited joint and several responsibilities for the tenders, the person said.The power ministry had held meetings with stakeholders to discuss factors leading to lukewarm response by vendors, a person familiar with the matter said.

Author: ANI
Headline: SC dismisses L&T plea over Sharavathi tendering process
Description: Larsen & Toubro challenged the order of the Division Bench comprising Chief Justice NV Anjaria and Justice Krishna S Dixit of the Karnataka High Court in the Supreme Court, which dismissed its appeal. The tender for the Sharavathi pumped storage project, which is currently being run by KPCL, has been bagged by the Megha Engineering & Infrastructures Ltd group, which quoted a lower price.
Article Body: The Supreme Court on Monday rejected Infrastructure Company Larsen & Toubro's Special Leave Petition (SLP) challenging the tendering process for the prestigious Sharavathi Pumped Storage project.  We are not inclined to entertain the Special Leave Petition under Article 136 of the Constitution of India,  the top court said. The Special Leave Petition is accordingly dismissed,  a bench headed by Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud said and dismissed the petition by the company L&T.Larsen & Toubro challenged the order of the Division Bench comprising Chief Justice NV Anjaria and Justice Krishna S Dixit of the Karnataka High Court in the Supreme Court, which dismissed its appeal.The tender for the Sharavathi pumped storage project, which is currently being run by KPCL, has been bagged by the Megha Engineering & Infrastructures Ltd group, which quoted a lower price.The Sharavathi river is a vital source of hydroelectric power in the state of Karnataka. (ANI)

Author: ETMarkets.com
Headline: Share price of LTIMindtree  rises  as Nifty  strengthens
Description: A total of 19,639 shares changed hands on the counter till 12:37PM (IST).
Article Body: Shares of LTIMindtree Ltd. gained 0.02 per cent to Rs 4749.5 in Tuesday's trade as of 12:37PM (IST). The stock hit a high price of Rs 4778.0 and low of Rs 4735.0 during the session.   The return on equity (ROE) for the stock stood at 22.89 per cent. Traded volume on the counter stood at 12:37PM shares and turnover at Rs 9.32 crore around that time. The stock of LTIMindtree Ltd. quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 6442.65 and 52-week low prices of Rs 4418.0, respectively.   The stock's Beta value, which measures its volatility in relation to the broader market, stood at 0.59.   Promotor/FII Holding  Promoters held 68.6 per cent stake in the company as of 31-Mar-2024, while overseas investors held 7.86 per cent and domestic institutional investors had 6.22 per cent.   Key Financials   The company reported consolidated sales of Rs 9100.5 crore for the quarter ended 31-Mar-2024, down 1.47 per cent from previous quarter's Rs 9236.1 crore and down 3.92 per cent from the year-ago quarter's Rs 8757.4 crore. Net profit after tax for the latest quarter stood at Rs 1099.9 crore, down 1.24 per cent from the same quarter a year ago.   Technicals The MACD signalled a bullish bias on the counter. The MACD is known for signalling trend reversals in traded securities or indices.  It is the difference between the 26-day and 12-day exponential moving averages. A nine-day exponential moving average, called the signal line, is plotted on topof the MACD to reflect  buy  or  sell  opportunities. When the MACD crosses below the signal line, it gives a bearish signal, indicating that the price of the security may see a downward movement and vice versa.

Article Body: Motilal Oswal has neutral call on Bajaj Finance Ltd. with a target price of Rs 7800. The current market price of Bajaj Finance Ltd. is Rs 7293.9.  Bajaj Finance Ltd., incorporated in the year 1987, is a Large Cap company (having a market cap of Rs 453581.93 Crore) operating in NBFC sector.   Bajaj Finance Ltd. key Products/Revenue Segments include Interest, Fees & Commission Income, Other Operating Revenue, Income From Sale Of Share & Securities and Service Charges for the year ending 31-Mar-2023.     Financials  For the quarter ended 31-03-2024, the company reported a Consolidated Total Income of Rs 14931.98 Crore, up 5.41 % from last quarter Total Income of Rs 14165.98 Crore and up 31.41 % from last year same quarter Total Income of Rs 11363.14 Crore. Company reported net profit after tax of Rs 3821.52 Crore in latest quarter.     Promoter/FII Holdings  Promoters held 54.69 per cent stake in the company as of 31-Mar-2024, while FIIs owned 17.14 per cent, DIIs 14.33 per cent.

Author: Nishtha Awasthi
Headline: Q4 results: How LTTS, Cyient, Zensar Technologies and Laurus Labs fared in March quarter
Description: LTTS reported 8% YoY growth in net profit at Rs 1,304 crore while the standalone revenue stood at Rs 9,647 crore, up by 9%.
Article Body: L&T Technology Services, Zensar Technologies, Cyient, and Laurus Labs declared their Q4 results after market hours on Thursday. All of them have declared dividends for shareholders.L&T Technology ServicesLTTS reported 8% YoY growth in net profit at Rs 1,304 crore while the standalone revenue stood at Rs 9,647 crore, up by 9%. Company’s EBIT margin stands at 17.1% as of the quarter ended March and the board has recommended a final dividend of Rs 33 per share.During the quarter, LTTS signed one USD 100 million, one USD 30 million and two deals each of USD 20 million and USD 10 million. Additionally, they signed one significant empanelment agreement. LTTS shares were down by 1% at Rs 5180.95 on the BSE on Thursday.CyientCyient’s revenue was up nearly 2.5% YoY to Rs 612 crore for the Q4FY24 while net profit stood at Rs 115 crore , which grew by 3% from Rs 112 crore for the same period last year. The board has recommended a final dividend of Rs 18 per share. It had also declared an interim dividend of Rs 12 per share in October 2023.Cyient closed at Rs 1,916, 1.3% higher on the BSE.Laurus LabsLaurus Labs reported a 26% YoY increase in PAT at Rs 76 crore, while their revenue stood at Rs 1,440 for Q4FY24, up 4% YoY.EBITDA increased by 10% to Rs 259 crore while the EBITDA margin stood at 18%. The company has announced an interim dividend of Rs 0.40 per share.Laurus Labs closed 2% lower at Rs 425.30 on the BSE on Thursday.Zensar TechnologiesZensar’s Q4 revenue stood at Rs 1,230 crore up by 1.4% YoY while the PAT rose by 45.4% at Rs 177 crore. The EBITDA grew 15.5% to Rs 2013 crore. The board has recommended a final dividend of Rs 7 per share, subject to shareholder approval. The record date would be announced at a later date.Zensar Technologies shares closed at Rs 575.20, down by 1% on the BSE.Also read: ACC Q4 Results: Profit jumps 300% YoY to Rs 945 crore, dividend of Rs 7.5 announced(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of The Economic Times)

Author: ETMarkets.com
Headline: LTIMindtree shares  down  2.37% as Nifty  gains
Description: The stock quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 6442.65 and low of Rs 4152.6.
Article Body: Shares of LTIMindtree Ltd. rose 2.37 per cent to Rs 4620.0 in Thursday's trade. It hit an intraday high of Rs 4680.75 and low of Rs 4593.05, respectively, during the day.   The stock quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 6442.65 and low of Rs 4152.6.   As of 02:04PM (IST), the counter saw total traded volume of 68,895 shares with a traded value of Rs 31.81 crore, according to NSE.   The stock had closed at Rs 4732.55 in the previous session.   The scrip has declined -7.7 per cent in the past one month till date, while the benchmark BSE Sensex has gained 0.09 per cent during the same period.   According to exchange data, the stock traded at a price-to-earnings (P/E) multiple of 30.59 while price-to-book ratio stood at 7.3. A higher P/E ratio shows that investors are willing to pay a higher price for per rupee earnings given by the stock because of better future growth expectations. The price-to-book value indicates the inherent value of a company and it reflects the price investors are ready to pay even for no growth in a business.   The stock belongs to the IT Consulting & Software - Mid Cap industry.    Promoter/FII Holding  Promoters held 68.6 per cent stake in the company as of 31-Mar-2024, while FII and MF ownership in the firm stood at 7.86 per cent and 6.22 per cent, respectively.    Key Financials  The company reported consolidated sales of Rs 9100.5 crore for the quarter ended 31-Mar-2024, down 1.47 per cent from the previous quarter's Rs 9236.1 crore and down 3.92 per cent from the year-ago quarter's Rs 8757.4 crore. Its net profit for the latest quarter stood at Rs 1099.9 crore, down 1.24 per cent from the same quarter a year ago.

Author: ETMarkets.com
Headline: Jubilant Food shares  down  0.31% as Sensex  rises
Description: A total of 27,847 shares changed hands on the counter till 12:07PM (IST)
Article Body: Shares of Jubilant Foodworks Ltd. fell 0.31 per cent to Rs 438.8 in Thursday's session as of 12:07PM (IST) even as the equity benchmark Sensex traded 3.45 points higher at 73856.39.   Earlier in the day, the stock witnessed a gap up start to the session. The stock quoted a 52-week high price of Rs 586.35 and a 52-week low of Rs 420.85 on NSE. Around 27847 shares changed hands on the counter till 12:07PM (IST).   The stock opened at Rs 440.45 and has touched an intraday high and low of Rs 441.85 and Rs 438.0 during the session so far. The counter quoted a price-to-earnings (PE) ratio of 131.81, earnings per share (EPS) of Rs 3.34 and price to book value (PB) of 14.26, while the return on equity (ROE) stood at Rs 17.33.    Promoter/ FII Holding The promoters held 41.94 per cent stake in the company as of April 25, while FII and MF ownerships stood at 23.24 per cent and 19.98 per cent, respectively.    Key Financials   With a market capitalisation of Rs 29046.39 crore, the company operates in the Restaurant & QSR industry. For the quarter ended 31-Dec-2023, the company reported consolidated sales of Rs 1382.27 crore, up 0.48 per cent from the previous quarter?s Rs 1375.69 crore and up 3.05 per cent from the same quarter a year ago. The company reported net profit of Rs 65.71 crore for the latest quarter, down 18.24 per cent from the corresponding quarter last year.    Technical Indicators  The relative strength index (RSI) of the stock stands at 40.84. The RSI oscillates between zero and 100. Traditionally, it is considered overbought condition when the RSI value is above 70 and oversold condition when it is below 30. Analysts say the RSI indicator should not be seen in isolation, as it may not be sufficient to take a trading call, just the way a fundamental analyst cannot give a  buy  or  sell  recommendation using a single valuation ratio.
